title: McKahn 2014 Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: Aged minimally in American oak that permeates the nose and palate, this is a full-bodied expression of melon and tangerine, thickly textured and rich in a way that coats the tongue.

title: Nisia 2015 Old Vines Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Pungent aromas of mustard, lees and citrus peel set up a slightly oily feeling palate. This tastes of salty citrus fruits, orange in particular. A solid, acidic finish is fresh for the most part but with a skin-driven texture.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Char, toast, herb and red-fruit aromas are followed by plump red and blue-fruit flavors, speckled with coffee accents. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.

title: Odfjell 2012 Orzada Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Lontué Valley)
description: Ripe aromas of baked cherry and plum lead to a powerful, firm palate with energy. This tastes meaty, salty and rugged, with black plum and cassis notes. The finish remains salty in flavor, with depth and cushion.

title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Falcoaria Branco Fernão Pires (Tejo)
description: With 50% wood aging, the wine creates contrasts between wood and vanilla flavors and crisp citrus fruits. It is ripe, full of grapefruit as well as a mineral, tight texture. It is crisp on the finish with refreshing acidity.

title: Pendulum 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla, clove, herb and dark fruit aromas lead to plentiful black-fruit flavors. The tannins are still tightly wound and need some time to come into their own.

title: Seven Hills 2013 McClellan Estate Vineyard Petit Verdot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The cocoa, dry chocolate, herb, purple-flower, medicine cabinet and graphite aromas show plenty of nuance. One the palate, the variety's tannins are well tamed and rather it's the acid that stands out. Enjoy with food to see it at its best.

title: Shooting Star 2014 Riesling (Lake County)
description: Attractive, spicy petrol and peach make a vivid aroma, and nicely ripe peach and nectarine flavors fill out the palate of this wine. Fruit forward but dry, it's low in alcohol, light bodied, slightly soft in texture and easy to appreciate.

title: Siduri 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Olallieberrries, grape seeds, roasting herbs and hot gravel show on the nose of this appellation blend by Adam Lee, whose recently sold his brand to Jackson Family but remains deeply involved. A marjoram-laced cranberry-juice flavor consumes the palate, lifted further by hints of dried fennel.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2013 Lahoma Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Staccato strikes of acidity keep luscious peach and nectarine flavors in elegant stride here. While zesty and spry, its juicy fruit flavors are persistent through a long finish. Drinks well now but should improve through 2020.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2013 Tango Oaks Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Zesty citrus and crushed-mineral tones take center stage in this gossamer-light wine. Bracing and lean, it offers invigorating refreshment and a cool touch of alpine green on the finish.

title: Rivino 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This all-out fruity wine smells like honeydew melon and cotton candy, tastes like fresh peach juice, and has a lively texture that tingles the tongue. It is impressively bright and fresh.

title: Vino Noceto NV Rosso Red (Amador County)
description: This rich but bracing dry wine is blended from Italian grape varieties. It has plenty of ripe plum and cherry shaded by black olive and savory herb nuances backed by moderate tannins. Unlike Noceto's other more elegant reds, this one is full bodied and ripe in flavor.

title: Willm 2015 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: This wine brims with almost overripe pear notes on the nose. The palate follows with equally full-fruited accents shot through with citric freshness, making for a super-juicy, super-easy, off-dry white. Drink soon to make most of the fruit.

title: Callaway 2013 Winemaker's Reserve Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Honey, jasmine, salted nectarine, yellow melon and plumeria flowers pop on the nose of this bottling that indicates Roussanne may do well in Temecula. There's solid yellow-grapefruit-pith grip to the palate, a touch of tart tangerine, slate minerality and some botanical elements. It's bright and tense for an often oily, easily over-ripened grape.

title: Camel Valley 2013 Cornwall Sparkling (England)
description: There is a flinty touch of reduction on the nose. The frothy palate follows with freshness and verve: there is rhubarb and lime peel, fresh lemon and tart greengage. The frothiness makes this exuberant and fun while the generous dosage puts us in mind of spring flowers and elder blossom.

title: Bolney Wine Estate NV Bolney Bubbly White (England)
description: The nose tells of the crisp green freshness of tart apples, the palate counters this with more generous, riper but still very fresh fruit and a wonderfully balm-like creaminess. It all comes together on the midpalate: rounded but unobtrusive autolysis embraces the tart briskness and rounds it all out. Totally refreshing, and does not take itself too seriously.

title: Chronic Cellars 2015 Eunice White (Central Coast)
description: A unique but quite successful blend of 75% Chardonnay, 14% Viognier, 8% Roussanne and 3% Marsanne, this bottling offers light pear cream, cantaloupe and daffodil on the pretty nose. The palate shows honeydew ripeness but with plenty of restraint thanks to lime zest and clean green fruits, wiping up with a tense texture on the finish.

title: Dance 2014 Kaiser Vineyard at The Benches Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: The aromas offer notes of char, toast and peach. The flavors are simultaneously broad and sleek in styling, with a finish that lingers.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)
description: Full and ripe, this is a lemon and crisp apple flavored wine. There is a hint of toast from the six months in barrel that also adds a little pepper. Fine acidity and a tangy texture suggests it could age. Drink this wine from 2017.

title: Domaine Cordier Père et Fils 2015 Cuvée Juliette Louise  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: This is a surprisingly powerful wine, with (for a Beaujolais) a high alcohol. Densely textured, the wine is concentrated and dark with plenty of acidity as well as strawberry fruits. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Riesling (Alsace)
description: Soft and mellow ripeness rises from the glass, suggesting ripe Mirabelle plum and warm citrus. The palate of this wine is bright with lemony, high-pitched freshness balanced by the dry, fruit-driven body and clean finish.

title: Algairen 2015 Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Concentrated aromas of raspberry, black cherry and blackberry set up a palate with moderately structured tannins. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and toast are nuanced. While this wine is dark and grapy on the finish, with a sense of smoothness. rounds it out.

title: Amici 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft tannins support a lighter style of leather, strawberry and herb in this structured, aromatic wine, speckled in cherry cola.

title: Ancient Peaks 2013 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: There is an elegant integration of aromas on the nose of this bottling, with black cherry, smoked beef and a touch of tobacco. The mouthfeel is very soft and full, presenting flavors of blueberry, crushed asphalt and tart black plum skin. A solid sipper now, it's likely to improve with some aging.

title: Beekeeper Cellars 2014 Montecillo Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: From a hillside vineyard near Moon Mountain overlooking the Sonoma Valley, this wine was blended with 5% Petite Sirah. While not as high in alcohol as some of the producer's other wines, it has a concentrated character on the palate, akin to blueberry syrup, with soft, moderate tannins and a dusty texture. Red and black cherry provide additional fruit flavor.

title: Domaine Zinck 2015 Portrait Riesling (Alsace)
description: The mellow scent of baked apple rises from the glass, cut by ripe, equally mellow freshness on the palate. This wine is mild for a Riesling but very enjoyable, clean and fruity, with a mellow apple note that really gets you in the end.

title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2014 Cuvée Engel Riesling (Alsace)
description: Rounded notions of ripe pear on the nose lead to a rounded, earthy but still perfumed palate of clean flavors and gentle fruit. This wine offers a fluid balance of freshness, definition and beautifully expressed orchard fruit.

title: Domaine François Schmitt 2014 Grand Cru Pfingstberg Paradis Riesling (Alsace)
description: Hints of pear perfume the nose on this wine, while the defined palate is bright with lemony freshness. Bundled concentration at the lean, taut core will round out with more bottle age. Drink 2017–2025.

title: Elqui Wines 2013 Red (Elqui Valley)
description: This blend of Syrah, Carmenère and Malbec is better than EW's varietal wines made from those same grapes, which proves that sometimes blends are best. It offers plum, currant and floral aromas before a fairly rich palate. Chocolaty blackberry and burnt notes end with a chocolate-driven finish.
